prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. Create a new coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Create the 2D sketch for the base 1. Create a new sketch on the XY plane. 2. Draw a rectangle with the following vertices: - Point 1: [0.0, 0.0] - Point 2: [0.75, 0.0] - Point 3: [0.75, 0.375] - Point 4: [0.0, 0.375] Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch Transform the 2D sketch using the following Euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 45.0, 0.0] (45 degrees about the Y axis) - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0225] (0.0225 units in the positive Z direction) Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch by a depth of 0.0225 units in the positive Z direction (towards the normal) and no depth in the opposite direction to create the 3D prism. Use a sketch scaling factor of 0.75. Shape description The resulting prism is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The sloped side is at a 45 degree angle. The height (z-dimension) of the sloped side is 0.0225 units (0.5 x 0.75 x 0.5). The width (y-dimension) of the sloped side is 0.375 units (0.5 x 0.75). The length (x-dimension) of the sloped side is 0.75 units.</description>
